article_node.title: Stocks sink under the weight of rising pressure from the bond market
article_node.summary: Wall Street slid 0.7% on Tuesday as a surge in 10‑year Treasury yields to 4.27% pulled the S&P 500 down, with Nvidia, Amazon and Apple among the biggest draggers.  Rising bond yields made high‑priced tech stocks less attractive, while concerns over Fed policy, Trump’s tariff stance and weaker manufacturing data added to the pressure.  Gold hit a record as investors sought a safe haven, and the market remains close to recent highs despite the downturn.
